step.context: \text{What is the condition for a function}\\ \text{to be continuous at a point }x=a?
step.reason: \text{If a function is continuous at a point,}\\ \text{then it can be drawn without lifting the}\\ \text{pencil. But if }\lim_{x\to a^-}f(x)\neq\lim_{x\to a^+}f(x)\\ \text{or }\lim_{x\to a}f(x) \neq f(a),\text{ then one will have}\\ \text{to lift the pencil.}\implies\text{ discontinuity.}

step.context: \text{Which of the following shows the}\\ \text{correct results for }\lim_{x\to a^-}f(x),\lim_{x\to a^+}f(x)\text{ and }f(a)?
step.reason: \text{If your calculations are correct, then}\\ \text{you will find that }\lim_{x\to a^-}f(x)=\lim_{x\to a^+}f(x)=f(a)\\ \text{for }x = 0,-3\text{ and }-5.\text{Moreover, }f(x)=5x-3\\ \text{is a straight line. And straight lines are continuous.}
